intro: Morongia distachya, commonly known as the slender morongia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in dense inflorescences, often blooming during the rainy season. Morongia distachya is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
